source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for inflammatory bowel disease
description: DTT is a therapeutic approach aimed at treating inflammatory bowel disease.

source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for inflammatory bowel disease
description: DTT has potential efficacy on Crohn's disease, although data are limited.

source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for inflammatory bowel disease
description: DTT may also be applicable to Ulcerative colitis, with insufficient data available.

source: Therapeutic Agents Targeting Cellular Signaling Pathways in IBD
description: These agents are designed to target cellular signaling mechanisms involved in IBD.

source: Therapeutic Agents Targeting Leukocyte Trafficking in Inflammatory Conditions
description: This category of agents influences leukocyte movement in the context of IBD.

source: Janus Kinase-Dependent Therapeutic Agents for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: JAK-dependent therapeutic agents are utilized in the treatment of IBD.

source: Janus Kinase-Independent Therapeutic Agents for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: Agents that do not involve Janus kinases are also used for treating IBD.
